thread.title: Watch: Chelsea keeps double dream alive
thread.title_full: Watch: Chelsea keeps double dream alive

title: Watch: Chelsea keeps double dream alive
text:
Watch: Chelsea keeps Premier League and FA Cup double dream alive with 4-0 win over Brentford AAP, AAP January 29, 2017 9:01am 
BRANISLAV Ivanovic scored on his potential farewell appearance as Chelsea beat neighbours Brentford 4-0 in the FA Cup fourth round at Stamford Bridge. 
Brentford, 15th in the Championship, took Chelsea to a replay four years ago, but there was little prospect of a repeat as the Blues claimed a 10th successive home win. 
Willian, Pedro and Michy Batshuayi, with a penalty, were also on target for the Premier League leaders, whose only concern came when Willian went off midway through the second half after holding his ankle. media_camera Chelsea's Willian celebrates scoring the opening goal. 
Ivanovic replaced Willian and scored his 34th Chelsea goal on his 377th appearance, amid suggestions his nine-year stay at Stamford Bridge could come to an end before Tuesday’s transfer deadline. 
Asmir Begovic, who will be allowed to leave for Bournemouth if Chelsea can find a replacement, made a number of key interventions to deny Brentford and show his value as Thibaut Courtois’ back-up. 
Brentford held their own early before Lasse Vibe was penalised for a body check on Pedro. 
Willian took the resulting free-kick and curled it beyond Daniel Bentley. 
Soon it was 2-0 when Batshuayi played the ball into the right channel and Ruben Loftus-Cheek left it for Pedro, who slid it beneath Bentley. media_camera Chelsea's Pedro celebrates scoring a goal. 
Batshuayi thought he had scored Chelsea’s third, but one scrambled chance was cleared before Pedro was offside as the Belgium striker found the net. Loftus-Cheek, who had a long-range shot tipped over, next snatched at a chance, firing straight at Bentley. 
Brentford had opportunities either side of halftime. Yoann Barbet struck a volley at Begovic and the goalkeeper pounced to repel the danger as Vibe hesitated after John Terry’s slip. 
Chelsea’s third finally came when Pedro ran down the right and fed the overlapping Ivanovic. media_camera Chelsea players celebrate Branislav Ivanovic’s goal. 
The Serbia right-back opted to power the ball low into the near corner before being enveloped by his teammates. 
Ivanovic, who has won every major club honour since his January 2008 arrival from Lokomotiv Moscow, was then fouled by Barbet and Batshuayi converted the resulting spot kick in an emphatic win.
